name: Pork Adobo
procedure: Marinate the pork in soy sauce vinegar, garlic, bay leaves, and peppercorns for at least 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a pot and sauté the onions and garlic until fragrant.
Add he pork and cook until browned.
Add the marinade, water, and bring to a boil
Lower the heat and simmer for 40-50 minutes or until the meat is tender
Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve with rice

name: Pork Sisig
ingredients: 500g pork belly (or face), boiled and chopped into small pieces
procedure: Boil the pork belly or pork face until tender. Drain and chop into small pieces.
Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onions and chilies until softened.
Add the chopped pork, soy sauce, vinegar, and calamansi juice.
Stir well and cook for a few minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
If you like it creamy, add mayonnaise and stir.
Serve the sisig on a sizzling plate and top with a raw egg (optional).
Serve with steamed rice.

name: Pork Menudo
ingredients: 1/2 cup pork liver, cut into cubes
procedure: Heat oil in a pot and sauté the garlic, onions, and tomatoes until soft.
Add the pork and cook until it turns brown.
Add the pork liver and cook for 5 minutes.
Add the soy sauce, tomato sauce, and water. Stir well and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the potatoes, carrots, bell peppers, and green peas. Continue cooking until vegetables are tender.
Season with salt, pepper, and raisins.
Simmer for an additional 10 minutes before serving.

name: Lechon Kawali
procedure: Boil the pork belly in a pot of water with onion, garlic, bay leaves, peppercorns, and salt.
Boil for about 45 minutes or until tender.
Let the pork belly cool, then pat dry.
Heat oil in a deep pan and fry the pork belly until golden and crispy.
Slice the pork into bite-sized pieces and serve with dipping sauce.

name: Pork Nilaga
ingredients: 500g pork (preferably pork belly or bone-in cuts)
1 corn on the cob, cut into pieces
procedure: In a large pot, combine pork, onion, garlic, and enough water to cover the meat.
Boil for 1-1.5 hours until the pork is tender.
Add potatoes and corn, and cook for another 10-15 minutes.
Add the string beans and pechay. Simmer for another 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper, and serve.

name: Pork Dinuguan
ingredients: 500g pork (liver, heart, or belly), cut into chunks
1 cup pork blood (available in Asian markets)
procedure: Heat oil in a pot and sauté the garlic, onions, and chilies until fragrant.
Add the pork and cook until browned.
Pour in the vinegar and let it simmer for 5 minutes to cook off the vinegar.
Add the pork blood and water or broth. Stir gently to combine.
Simmer for 30-40 minutes or until the pork is tender.
Season with salt and pepper, and serve hot.
